thread.title: President Trump Will Close Out Hectic Week With A Campaign Rally
thread.title_full: President Trump Will Close Out Hectic Week With A Campaign Rally

author: Andrew Kerr
title: President Trump Will Close Out Hectic Week With A Campaign Rally
text:
President Trump Will Close Out Hectic Week With A Campaign Rally "... still have much work to do." by Andrew Kerr February 15, 2017 at 4:16pm Advertisement - story continues below 
President Trump is returning to campaign form. 
In a tweet Wednesday, the president announced he will hold a rally at the Orlando-Melbourne International Airport on Saturday. 
“We are going to put America back to work. We are going to put people before government,” the tweet’s accompanying picture states. Advertisement - story continues below 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 15, 2017 
This rally will be Trump’s first as sitting president and his first since concluding his post-election “thank you” tour in December. 
Unlike most presidents, Trump filed an official statement of candidacy with the Federal Election Commission on the same day as his inauguration, meaning he had already raised enough money to qualify as an official 2020 presidential candidate. Advertisement - story continues below 
Another reason for this, as Trump’s campaign website states , is because Trump’s “movement cannot stop now — we still have much work to do.” 
“This campaign will be a voice for all Americans, in every city near and far, who support a more prosperous, safe and strong America. That’s why our campaign cannot stop now — our movement is just getting started,” states the president’s campaign website. 
Trump’s Saturday afternoon rally will close out a tumultuous week for the president. 
Damaging leaks caused Trump’s national security adviser, Michael Flynn, to tender his resignation Monday after only 24 days on the job. Advertisement - story continues below
